title: Belle Schmidt
text:
Welcome to my website! My name is Isabelle (or Belle) Schmidt and I am currently an undergrad at St Olaf College. On campus I am heavily involved in the athletic community. I am a member of the Varsity softball team, do data analytics for the football team, and am the president of the Sports Analytics Club. I also participate in intramural sports like broomball, volleyball, and basketball. In addition, in the 2023-24 academic year, I won the Ole Pride Award which recognizes the student who attended the most St Olaf sporting events that year. Outside of academics and athletics, I enjoy listening to music, trying new restaurants, and traveling. This past Summer, I was a Fellow at the Carnegie Mellon Sports Analytics Camp where I was mentored by sports analytics industry experts Doctor Ron Yurko, Quang Nguyen, and Sean Ahmed as I collaborated on a project evaluating the baseball Stuff+ metric. After graduation I hope to work as a data analyst in the sports industry.


BA in Math with Statistics & Data Science and Management concentrations  2026 | St. Olaf College
High School Diploma  2022 | Eastlake High School

title: Projects
text:
Below, you can find my projects!














Capstone





Capstone Project on evaluting the effectiveness of FanGraph’s Stuff+ Model for SURE 2024 at CMU





Jul 26, 2024












EDA Project





EDA Project on WNBA Team and Player Success for SURE 2024 at CMU





Jun 14, 2024












Personal Football Project





Currently in progress but showcases my creativity in the data cleaning proccess





Jan 12, 2025












Spotify





Final project for my Data Science 2 course showcasing my work in Shiny





May 22, 2024
